oai_dc:dc.dc:title: HYDRODYNAMIC FIELD OF A WAVE AT CONSTANT DEPTH
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bureste, H.
Chartier, Ch.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave measurement
wave breaking
wave flume
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have used chronophotographic methods with aluminum powder to record wave motion. In this method, it is necessary to photograph fine selected and prepared particles which sink slowly but which are nevertheless large enough to reflect light through about half a meter of water in the wave flume.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 5 (1954): Proceedings of 5th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Grenoble, France, 1954.; 3
